content:
EventSource.EventData Struct

Definition

Provides the event data for creating fast stem.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.WriteEvent* overloads by using the stem.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.WriteEventCore* method.

In this Article

protected struct EventSource.EventData
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
EventSource.EventData

Remarks

The following example shows how to use the EventSource.EventData structure. 


[NonEvent]  
public unsafe void WriteEvent(int eventId, int arg1, int arg2, int arg3, int arg4) {  
    EventData* dataDesc = stackalloc EventProvider.EventData[4];  

    dataDesc[0].DataPointer = (IntPtr)(&arg1);  
    dataDesc[0].Size = 4;  
    dataDesc[1].DataPointer = (IntPtr)(&arg2);  
    dataDesc[1].Size = 4;  
    dataDesc[2].DataPointer = (IntPtr)(&arg3);  
    dataDesc[2].Size = 4;  
    dataDesc[3].DataPointer = (IntPtr)(&arg4);  
    dataDesc[3].Size = 4;  

    WriteEventCore(eventId, 4, (IntPtr)dataDesc);  
}

Properties

DataPointer

Gets or sets the pointer to the data for the new stem.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.WriteEvent* overload.

public IntPtr DataPointer { get; set; }
Value
IntPtr

The pointer to the data.

Size

Gets or sets the number of payload items in the new stem.Diagnostics.Tracing.EventSource.WriteEvent* overload.

public int Size { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of payload items in the new overload.
